name: RM
description:
'''Kim Nam-joon''' ({{Korean|김남준}}; born September 12, 1994), known professionally as '''RM''' (formerly '''Rap Monster'''), is a South Korean rapper, songwriter, and record producer. He is the leader of South Korean boy band [[BTS]], under [[Big Hit Music|Big Hit Music]]. Born in Seoul and raised in Ilsan, RM began his music career in the underground Korean hip-hop scene as a teenager, going by the name Runch Randa. He joined Big Hit in 2010, and debuted as part of BTS in June 2013.

RM released his first solo [[mixtape]], ''[[RM (mixtape)|RM]]'', in 2015, followed by his second mixtape, ''[[Mono (mixtape)|Mono]]'', in 2018. The latter became the highest-charting album by a Korean solo artist in the United States in history when it peaked at number 26 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. He made his official solo debut in 2022, with the release of his studio album ''[[Indigo (RM album)|Indigo]]''. The project featured contributions from various artists including [[Erykah Badu]] and [[Anderson .Paak]]. It peaked at number three on the ''Billboard'' 200, becoming the highest-charting album by a Korean solo artist of all-time.{{efn-ua|name=|The record was later surpassed by his BTS bandmates [[Jimin]] and [[Suga]], who both peaked at number two on the ''Billboard'' 200 with their debut solo albums, ''[[Face (Jimin album)|Face]]'' (2023) and ''[[D-Day (album)|D-Day]]'' (2023) respectively.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/2023/05/03/entertainment/kpop/Korea-Kpop-BTS/20230503124842386.html|title=Suga lands at No. 2 on Billboard 200 with 'D-DAY' album|last=Cho|first=Yong-jun|date=May 1, 2023|work=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230503235753/https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/2023/05/03/entertainment/kpop/Korea-Kpop-BTS/20230503124842386.html|archive-date=May 3, 2023|url-status=live|access-date=May 3, 2023}}</ref>}} In 2024, he experimented with [[Alternative rock|alternative]] music on his sophomore album ''[[Right Place, Wrong Person]]'', which peaked at number five on the ''Billboard'' 200 and garnered [[Right Place, Wrong Person#Accolades|critical acclaim]]. RM has also collaborated with artists such as [[Warren G]], [[Krizz Kaliko]], [[MFBTY]], [[Primary (musician)|Primary]], [[Gaeko]], [[Wale (rapper)|Wale]], [[Fall Out Boy]], [[Younha]], [[Megan Thee Stallion]], [[Tablo]], and [[Lil Nas X]].
